content.question: Which of the following nineteenth-century processes most directly contributed to the migration of Indian laborers to Fiji as described in the passage?

choices.label: Indian merchants acted as brokers and middlemen for European East India companies.
Colonial states in Asia and the Pacific relied on coerced labor to work on plantations.
Prior to the abolition of the slave trade, Indian slaves were exported to the islands in the Pacific Ocean and the Indian Ocean.
Indo-Muslim traders spread Islam to the islands of Southeast Asia.

content.answer: Colonial states in Asia and the Pacific relied on coerced labor to work on plantations.

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
